CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 25, 1950, pg. 17, reads: "Miners Get Groceries - Officials of a Coverdale miners local of United Mine Workers examine some of the truckload of groceries presented to them last Friday by the Pittsburgh local of the American Newspaper Guild, of which members of the Pittsburgh Sun-Telegraph, Pittsburgh Post-Gazette and The Pittsburgh Courier and the wire service and photographic news service, editorial and business employes [employees] are members. The miners, whose mine has been closed permanently, were given a van-load of groceries. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of eight men, members of United Mine Workers and workers at closed Coverdale mine, holding canned goods and groceries donated by American Newspaper Guild
